intro: Podocarpium duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's podocarp, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae, which includes conifer-like evergreen trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, needle-like leaves and produces small, cone-like structures that contain its seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
